item.title: 交易日 不确定性抨击风险偏好
item.description: 美国股市、债券收益率和美元周四全线下跌，原因是市场再次担心人工智能泡沫和对美国劳动力市场强劲程度的担忧。【原文：U.S. stocks, bond yields and the dollar all fell on Thursday, dragged down by renewed fears of an AI bubble and worries over the strength of the U.S. labor market.】

item.title: 特斯拉股东批准伊隆-马斯克 8,780 亿美元薪酬计划
item.description: 特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周四大获全胜，股东们批准了未来十年高达 8,780 亿美元的薪酬方案，支持他将这家电动汽车制造商打造成人工智能和机器人巨头的愿景。【原文：Tesla CEO Elon Musk scored a resounding victory on Thursday as shareholders approved a pay package of as much as $878 billion over the next decade, endorsing his vision of morphing the EV maker into an AI and robotics juggernaut.】

item.title: 荷兰官员表示相信 Nexperia 芯片将在未来几天内走向世界
item.description: 荷兰经济部长文森特-卡雷曼斯（Vincent Karremans）周四表示，他相信荷兰芯片制造商Nexperia生产的计算机芯片将在未来几天内到达欧洲和世界其他地区的客户手中。【原文：The Netherlands' economy minister, Vincent Karremans, said on Thursday he trusts computer chips made by Dutch chipmaker Nexperia will reach customers in Europe and the rest of the world in the coming days.】

item.title: 澳大利亚麦格理半年利润增长；扩大股票回购规模
item.description: 麦格理集团（Macquarie Group）周五公布，在资产管理、银行和金融服务部门强劲业绩的帮助下，上半年利润有所增长，并表示将进一步回购价值高达 20 亿澳元（13.0 亿美元）的股票。【原文：Macquarie Group posted a rise in first-half profit on Friday, helped by strong performance in its asset management and banking and financial services arms, and said it would further buy back up to A$2 billion ($1.30 billion) worth of shares.】

item.title: 波音公司获得哈萨克斯坦阿斯塔纳航空公司 15 架梦想飞机订单
item.description: 波音公司周四表示，已收到哈萨克斯坦航空公司阿斯塔纳航空（Air Astana）最多15架787梦想飞机的订单。【原文：Boeing said on Thursday it had received an order for up to 15 787 Dreamliners from Kazakhstan carrier Air Astana.】

item.title: 特朗普政府宣布在中亚与波音公司达成交易
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普政府周四宣布了向中亚国家哈萨克斯坦、塔吉克斯坦和乌兹别克斯坦的航空公司出售多达37架波音飞机的新交易。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's administration announced Thursday new deals to sell up to 37 Boeing airplanes to airlines in the Central Asian nations of Kazakhstan, Tajikistan and Uzbekistan.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，天空电视台（Sky）所有者康卡斯特（Comcast）正在洽谈收购 ITV 的广播部门
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引知情人士的话报道，天空电视台（Sky News）的所有者康卡斯特公司（Comcast）正在洽谈收购英国广播公司 ITV 的媒体和娱乐部门。【原文：Sky News-owner Comcast is in talks to buy British broadcaster ITV's media and entertainment unit, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 美联储哈马克认为目前无需加息以降低通胀率
item.description: 克利夫兰联储主席贝丝-哈马克（Beth Hammack）周四表示，她并不认为美国央行需要加息来应对她认为过高的通胀压力，同时她也承认这一观点可能会发生变化。【原文：Cleveland Federal Reserve President Beth Hammack said on Thursday she does not think the U.S. central bank needs to raise interest rates to combat inflation pressures she considers too high, while acknowledging how that view might change.】

item.title: 新闻集团季度收入超出预期，原因是道琼斯和数字房地产服务部门实现增长
item.description: 媒体集团新闻集团周四公布的第一季度营收超出华尔街预期，主要得益于道琼斯和数字房地产服务部门的增长。【原文：Media conglomerate News Corp beat Wall Street estimates for first-quarter revenue on Thursday, bolstered by growth at its Dow Jones and digital real estate services segments.】

item.title: 停止向中国客户销售后，MP 材料公司季度亏损扩大
item.description: 稀土公司 MP Materials 周四表示，作为获得美国政府财政支持协议的一部分，该公司停止向中国客户销售稀土，导致其第三季度亏损扩大。【原文：Rare earths company MP Materials said on Thursday its third-quarter loss widened as it stopped sales to Chinese customers as part of an agreement to receive U.S. government financial backing.】

item.title: 美国页岩油生产商 EOG Resources 第三季度利润超出预期
item.description: 美国石油天然气资源公司（EOG Resources）周四公布的第三季度利润超过了分析师的预期，因为产量的增加帮助这家美国石油天然气生产商抵消了原油价格的下跌。【原文：EOG Resources beat analysts' estimates for third-quarter profit on Thursday, as a rise in output helped the U.S. oil and gas producer offset a drop in crude prices.】

item.title: 科威资本将在特朗普宣布的交易中开采哈萨克斯坦钨矿
item.description: 根据特朗普政府将于周四宣布的一项协议，矿业投资公司科威资本（Cove Capital）将与国有矿业公司 JSC Tau-Ken Samruk 合作开发哈萨克斯坦的一个大型钨矿。【原文：Mining investment firm Cove Capital will develop a large tungsten deposit in Kazakhstan with the state mining firm JSC Tau-Ken Samruk under a deal to be announced by the Trump administration on Thursday.】

item.title: 消费者支出低迷，百佳超市利润不及预期，股价下滑
item.description: 由于经济不确定性持续存在以及支付行业竞争加剧，布洛克公司周四第三季度利润未达华尔街预期，导致盘后股价下跌超过 11%。【原文：Block missed Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit on Thursday amid persistent economic uncertainty and intensifying competition in the payments sector, sparking a more than 11% slide in its shares after the bell.】

item.title: Gen Digital 因 MoneyLion 整合和网络安全需求而上调年度收入预期
item.description: 受网络安全产品需求强劲和收购金融科技公司 MoneyLion 的影响，Gen Digital 周四连续第二个季度上调了全年营收预期。【原文：Gen Digital raised its annual revenue forecast for a second consecutive quarter on Thursday, helped by robust demand for its cybersecurity products and the acquisition of fintech firm MoneyLion.】

item.title: 业务需求强劲，Expedia 上调 2025 年收入预期，股价上涨
item.description: 在线旅游平台 Expedia 第三季度利润超出华尔街预期，受惠于商业客户的强劲需求，该公司股价盘后上涨近 10%，并上调了对 2025 年收入增长的预期。【原文：Online travel platform Expedia boosted its forecast for 2025 revenue growth, after beating Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit, helped by strong demand from its business clients, sending its shares up nearly 10% after the bell.】

item.title: Airbnb第三季度利润和收入因国际需求强劲而增长
item.description: 度假租赁公司 Airbnb 周四公布的第三季度利润和收入均有所增长，主要得益于拉丁美洲和亚太地区等市场强劲的预订量。【原文：Vacation rental firm Airbnb posted higher third-quarter profit and revenue on Thursday, helped by strong bookings in markets such as Latin America and Asia Pacific.】

item.title: 独家报道康卡斯特聘请银行家研究竞购华纳兄弟发现公司事宜
item.description: 据四位熟知内情的消息人士透露，康卡斯特已经聘请了财务顾问，并获得了财务信息，以探讨竞购华纳兄弟发现公司的制片厂和流媒体业务。【原文：Comcast has retained financial advisors and gained access to financial information as it explores a bid for Warner Bros Discovery’s studio and streaming businesses, according to four sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州起诉 Roblox，指控其向家长隐瞒安全问题
item.description: Roblox 已被德克萨斯州总检察长肯-帕克斯顿（Ken Paxton）起诉，他于周四指控该在线游戏平台在对儿童构成安全风险方面欺骗家长。【原文：Roblox has been sued by Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton, who on Thursday accused the online gaming platform of deceiving parents about the safety risks it poses to children.】

item.title: OpenAI 首席执行官 Altman 表示，大规模人工智能数据中心建设 "不需要政府担保
item.description: ChatGPT 母公司 OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）周四表示，"不希望政府为其数据中心提供担保"，同时补充说，这家处于人工智能热潮中心的初创公司预计今年年底的年化收入将超过 200 亿美元。【原文：ChatGPT parent OpenAI does not "want government guarantees" for its data centers, CEO Sam Altman said on Thursday, while adding that the startup at the heart of the artificial intelligence boom expects to end this year with an annualized revenue run rate above $20 billion.】

item.title: 星链公司与 Veon 公司签署具有里程碑意义的全球直接对蜂窝协议，卫星对手机的竞争日趋白热化
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）子公司Starlink周四表示，该公司与电信集团Veon达成了迄今为止最大的直达蜂窝协议，为超过1.5亿潜在客户提供服务，卫星与智能手机连接领域的竞争正在加剧。【原文：Elon Musk's Starlink, a subsidiary of SpaceX, secured its largest direct-to-cell deal yet with telecoms group Veon , granting access to over 150 million potential customers, both companies said on Thursday, as competition in satellite-to-smartphone connectivity intensifies.】

item.title: 美国共和党议员称赞特朗普阻止英伟达芯片从中国出口
item.description: 美国八位共和党参议员周四在一封信中对唐纳德-特朗普总统决定继续拒绝中国获得英伟达（Nvidia）最先进的人工智能芯片表示赞赏。【原文：A group of eight Republican U.S. senators in a letter on Thursday applauded President Donald Trump's decision to continue denying China access to Nvidia's most advanced artificial intelligence chips.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：福特考虑淘汰 F-150 电动卡车
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四援引知情人士的话报道，福特高管正在考虑放弃电动版 F-150 皮卡。【原文：Ford executives are considering scrapping the electric version of the F-150 pickup truck, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 白宫人工智能沙皇排除联邦救助人工智能行业的可能性
item.description: 白宫人工智能和加密货币沙皇大卫-萨克斯（David Sacks）表示，随着美国努力巩固其在人工智能这一蓬勃发展的技术领域的全球领导者地位，联邦不会为人工智能提供救助。【原文：David Sacks, the White House artificial intelligence and crypto czar, said that there will be no federal bailout for AI, as U.S. races to cement its position as a global leader in the booming technology.】

item.title: 美国联合航空公司将削减 4% 的周五至周日航班
item.description: 美国联合航空公司（United Airlines）周四表示，在美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）为解决空中交通管制安全问题而指示削减美国 40 个高流量机场的航班后，该公司计划在周五至周日削减 4% 的航班。【原文：United Airlines said on Thursday it plans to cut 4% of its flights Friday through Sunday after the Federal Aviation Administration directed reductions at 40 high-traffic U.S. airports to address air traffic control safety concerns.】

item.title: 华盛顿邮报》称它是与甲骨文软件有关的网络漏洞受害者之一
item.description: 华盛顿邮报》称，它是与甲骨文软件有关的大规模网络漏洞的受害者之一。【原文：The Washington Post said it is among victims of a sweeping cyber breach tied to Oracle software.】

item.title: 喜力斥资 4.62 亿美元在巴西新建工厂，以促进优质啤酒发展
item.description: 荷兰啤酒酿造商喜力周四在巴西米纳斯吉拉斯州开设了一家新的啤酒厂，这是巴西饮料行业最大的投资项目之一，该厂将重点生产优质啤酒。【原文：Dutch brewer Heineken on Thursday opened a new brewery in the Brazilian state of Minas Gerais, in one of the largest investments from the beverage sector in the country, as the facility will focus on premium beer production.】

item.title: 诺和诺德预计 2026 年全球销售额将以较低的个位数下降
item.description: 诺和诺德（Novo Nordisk）周四公布了一项协议，将为美国政府支持的保险项目和现金支付者降低流行的GLP-1减肥药的价格，诺和诺德预计2026年的全球销售额将出现低个位数百分比的下降。【原文：Novo Nordisk expects global sales to decline by low-single-digit percentage in 2026 after the drugmaker unveiled a deal on Thursday to slash prices of popular GLP-1 weight‑loss drugs for U.S. government-backed insurance programs and cash payers.】

item.title: 美联储主席米兰称预计 12 月降息
item.description: 美联储理事斯蒂芬-米兰（Stephen Miran）表示，他预计美国央行将在 12 月降息，尽管有许多无投票权的决策者可能并不希望降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran says he expects the U.S. central bank to cut interest rates in December, despite the number of non-voting policymakers who may not want to.】

item.title: 高盛提拔 638 名董事总经理，创 2021 年以来新高
item.description: 华尔街贷款公司高盛（Goldman Sachs）在一份公司备忘录中表示，明年将有 638 名高管晋升为董事总经理，这是自 2021 年以来的最高值，因为该银行受益于整个行业投资银行业务的回暖。【原文：Wall Street lender Goldman Sachs will promote 638 executives to managing directors next year, the highest since 2021, a company memo said, as the bank benefits from a pick-up in investment banking across the industry.】

item.title: 瑞波币称 "瘦身 "美联储主账户虽有限制但仍有吸引力
item.description: 加密货币巨头瑞波公司（Ripple）的一位高管表示，该公司支持为非银行设立一个 "瘦身 "美联储支付账户的想法，这可能会改变游戏规则，同时解决银行对金融稳定性和竞争风险的担忧。【原文：Crypto giant Ripple supports the idea of a "skinny" Federal Reserve payments account for non-banks, which could still be a game changer while addressing banks' concerns over financial stability and competition risks, a top company executive said.】
